data.text: @kellsbells75162 I believe my best friend, son, and granddaughter had it, too, before they knew what COVID was, right about the same time two years ago.
Oh, the cracked rib was from coughing so hard
@NewsatHoff You might have been among the first cases. Back before COVID had an official name. So many people I know had the same "bad cold" or pneumonia at the same time
@ngff384 I'm glad you don't have any lasting effect. It was just so bad and lasted forever

@kellsbells75162 Right around the Chiefs Super Bowl win (Feb 2020), my wife, my father, and I all had coughs that wouldn’t go away for a month and a half. We probably had it then and have been over it since.

@kellsbells75162 I know that it seems unlikely but between September to October 2019 I had the worst bout of chest pain and coughing I’ve ever had and felt completely lethargic. Doctors couldn’t figure it out at all (had many expensive tests). Wondering now if that was COVID or if too early

@kellsbells75162 It totally sucks no knowing, but like you said, there was no test

My son was 11 months at the time, and he got really sick, too. Not a great situation. We just have to hope it wasn't, and if it was, that there are no long-term effects
@BillsVhs That sucks. You might have had it too
@kellsbells75162 My wife and I were both in urgent cares about two years ago, too. Our strep and flu tests were negative, so we were both sent home with "bad colds" 🤷‍♂️
